intro: Amylotheca brittenii, commonly known as the brittleleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant features small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pink petals. Its leaves are typically narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Amylotheca brittenii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
